alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 4:13PM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Idaho, including the following counties, Blaine and Custer. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, with ponding of water in urban or other areas occurring or imminent. Quick rises on already elevated rivers and streams are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, with rainfall rates up to 0.25 inches of rain occurring. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ketchum, Sun Valley, Mackay Reservoir, Trail Creek Pass, Chilly Barton Flat, Twin Bridges Airport, Herd Lake, Willow Creek Summit and Mt Borah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
